description.narrative:
Beslut om Insats Projektdokumentet har tagits fram av Sveriges ambassad (Sida) i samråd med de båda kommunförbunden i landet, AMC (Associations of Municipalities & Cities), Förslaget har presenterat för Schweiz ambassad (Swiss Development Agency - SDC) för medfinansiering. Den slutliga utformningen av projektdokumentet kommer utarbetas under en inceptionsperiod. Implementerare av projektet föreslås vara (SALAR/SKL International), ett företag inom Sveriges Kommuner och Landsting.
Sverige kommer att vara den ledande biståndsgivaren och Schweiz medfinansiär. Båda organisationerna kommer att ha ett 50:50 finansieringsarrangemang.
Den föreslagna projektidén är i linje med de nationella, entitets och lokala utvecklingsprioriteringarna, samt landstrategin för den Sveriges och Schweiz ambassader och utvecklingssamarbete. Inom den komplexa institutionella och rättsliga systemet och den ofullständiga politiska kontext för decentralisering och lokalt styre i Bosnien och Hercegovina (BiH), är AMCs funktion en viktig faktor som kan underlätta för ett mera demokratiskt deltagande från alla nivåer. De agerar i utrymmet mellan deras valkretsar (kommunens) behov och intressen och beslutsprocesser från myndigheter på högre nivå. Dessutom är det viktigt att stärka rollen av AMC genom att påverka och förbättra ramen för decentralisering och EU-processer.
Det övergripande målet med projektet är: Ökad kapacitet hos Kommunförbunden i Federation BiH och Republika Srpska entiteterna, de stödjer aktivt kommunerna i tillhandahållandet av allomfattande, effektiva och ansvarsfulla tjänster till medborgarna, och främjar skapande av en gynnsam ram för decentralisering och lokalt styre i Bosnien och Hercegovina.
Projektet kommer att fokusera på institutionell utveckling och organisatoriskt stärkande i båda entiteterna i Bosnien och Hercegovina för effektivare och ändamålsenliga kommunförbund, i enlighet med de prioriterade områden som fastställs i AMCs Strategiska planer 2015-2019. Lokala myndigheter, myndigheter på högre nivåer och andra nyckelaktörer inom den lokala styret kommer att delta i arbetet för att underlätta bättre villkor för lokal utveckling och tillhandahållande av tjänster till medborgarna.
Två förväntade resultat för att uppnå det övergripande målet är: – Resultat 1: AMC presenterar effektiva institutionella och organisatoriska förändringar, förstärker valkretsar och driver påverkansprocesser enligt kommunernas krav mot högre nivåerna av regeringen. – Resultat 2: AMC tillhandahålla kvalitativa tjänster till kommuner och kontinuerligt bygga upp deras kapacitet för att skapa demokratisk politik och leverans av allomfattande tjänster för medborgarna, i linje med Europeiska stadga för lokalt självstyre och de kraven som gäller för EU anslutning. Projektet kommer att genomföras gemensamt med AMC Federation BiH och AMC Republika Srpska och SALAR/SKL International, ett företag inom Sveriges Kommuner och Landsting, som ett understödjande organ. AMCs kommer att vara direkta samarbetspartners och mottagarna för projektet. Inledningsfasen kommer att ske från den 2017.01.01 till den 2017.06.30. Inledningsperioden kommer att bestå av olika faser, intervjuer och utarbetandet av projektdokument med en detaljerad budget och resultatram. Det internationella understödjande organet (SALAR/SKL Int.) kommer att hantera en del av projektets budget som kommer att bestå av intern expertis och outsourcad expertis för utbildning (seminarier, studieresor etc). Budgeten för AMCs kommer att bestå av medel som öronmärkts för genomförandet av strategiska planer och budget för institutionell utveckling och organisatorisk stärkande stöd Sverige kommer att teckna avtal med SALAR. Båda givarna (Sverige och Schweiz) kommer att underteckna étt samfinansieringavtal vilket kommer att definiera tydliga roller för varje givare. Sverige kommer dessutom att underteckna avtalen mellan Sverige och de båda AMCs. Övergripande frågor: Det föreslagna projektet kommer att stödja verksamheter som syftar till att integrera god praxis i samband med jämställdhet, miljö och etik/antikorruption, i alla stadier av projektförvaltningscykeln. Den planerade projekttiden är fyra år (2017-2019).Det slutliga beslutet för förlängningen av projektverksamheten för ytterligare ett år dvs fram till 2020-12-31, kommer att bero på projektdokumentet slutsats/ rekommendationer. Totala budgeten för genomförandet av projektet är cirka 22 miljoner kronor (22 MSEK) där Sverige och Schweiz bidrar med lika mycket (11 000 000 kronor vardera).

The Project Document has been developed by the Embassy of Sweden (Sida) in consultation with both Associations of Municipalities and Cities (AMCs) and presented to the Embassy of Switzerland (Swiss Development Agency -SDC) for co-financing. The final design of the Project Document will come during the Inception period. Implementer of the project is Swedish Association of Local Authorities and Regions (SALAR) Sweden will have the role of lead donor and Switzerland will be the co-donor. Both the Development agencies will have a 50:50 funding arrangement. The proposed project idea is aligned with national, entity and local development priorities as well as with the country strategies of the Swedish and Swiss Embassies. In the complex institutional and legal system and incomplete policy context for Decentralization and Local Governance in Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH), the AMC’s are important cohesive factors that facilitate bottom-up policy developments and bridge numerous gaps in inter-institutional communication. They act in the space between their constituencies’ (municipality’s) needs and interests and higher level authorities’ decision-making processes. Furthermore, it is important to strengthen the role of AMCs in influencing and enhancing framework for decentralization and EU processes. The overall goal of the project is: The two entities AMCs, with advanced capacities, actively support local governments in the provision of inclusive, efficient and accountable services to the citizens, and foster creation of a conducive framework for decentralization and local governance in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The project will focus on Institutional Development and Organizational Strengthening of both entity AMC's in Bosnia and Herzegovina for efficient and effective fulfilment of their core functions, in accordance with priority areas defined in the AMCs' Strategic Plans 2015-2019. However, local governments, higher levels of government and other key actors in the local governance sector will be involved in the efforts to facilitate more favourable conditions for local development and service provision to citizens. Two expected outcomes required for the achievement of the overall goal are: -Outcome 1: AMCs’ introduce effective institutional and organizational changes, strengthen constituencies and run advocacy processes according to the municipalities’ demands towards upper levels of Government. -Outcome 2: AMC's provide quality services to municipalities and continually build their capacities for creation of democratic policies and delivery of inclusive services to citizens, in line with the European Charter for Local Self Government and EU accession requirements. The project will be jointly implemented by AMC Federation of BiH and AMC Republic of Srpska and SALAR/SKL International as a Facilitating Agency. The AMCs will be direct partners and beneficiaries of the project. An Inception phase will take place from 1st January 2017 until 30th June 2017. The inception period will comprise start up, desk research, interviews and designing the full Project Document including a detailed budget and Result Framework. The international Facilitating Agency ( SALAR/SKL Int.) will manage a part of the project budget that will consist of its in-house expertise ( mainly as a coach and a mentor, bringing in inspiration and experiences) and outsourced expertise for educational events (workshops, study tours). The budget for AMC’s will consist of the funding earmarked for implementation of Strategic Plans and the budget for institutional development and organizational strengthening support. Sweden will sign the Grant Agreement with SALAR. Both donors ( Sweden and Switzerland) will sign the Co-financing Agreement that will define clear roles for each donor. Furthermore Sweden will sign the Grant Agreements between Sweden and both AMCs. Crosscutting issues: The proposed project will support activities aimed at mainstreaming good practices related to gender, the environment and ethics/anticorruption, across all stages of the project management cycle. The envisaged project duration is four years (2017-2019). The final decision on the extension of the project activities for additional year, i.e. 31.December 2020 will depend on the Project document findings/recommendations. Total budget for the Project implementation is around 22 million SEK (22 MSEK) equally contributed by Sweden and Swiss (11 000 000 SEK each).

description.narrative: The overall assessment is that the project pursues the approach and intervention strategy set out in the Project document, with some delays in activities, and is within the agreed budget framework. Both AMCs involved more staff in project activities during the second year of implementation, while most of the burden being carried by the respective Project Managers. According to the Internal review of the project “this, in combination with the flat organisational structures where all staff are on the same level, makes it difficult for the project managers to delegate responsibilities for internal development processes to their colleagues.” This has been a cause of some of the delays, which were also identified by the Internal review, and project partners have agreed on measures necessary to mitigate the effects of delays created during 2019. Generally, the scope of the project widened to cover an increased number of aspects of the AMCs’ work, particularly in the areas of EU integration, local government finance, internal and external communication, and greater interactions with members. As identified by the Internal review report, activities planned for the second year of the project put more responsibilities for implementation of activities on the AMCs themselves and required more input from other staff in implementing activities in those areas, but also taking responsibility for steering the project in that direction. In terms of results, some progress is visible at the level of impact even earlier in the life of the project than anticipated. Progress is significantly more visible than last year at the level of outcomes and bridging outcomes. At the level of impact, the main results are visible in an improved legal and financial position of municipalities in both entities, which has been created by changes to laws and regulations proposed and advocated by AMCs on behalf of municipalities. Although not all of the policy changes can be attributed directly to the project, they are proof of stronger AMCs and improved practices in the area of evidence-based advocacy, representation of members’ interests and new channels of communication with higher levels of government. At the level of outcomes and bridging outcomes, results are visible in all three outcome areas. AMCs are more effective in opening new channels of communication with international and domestic stakeholders, including government representatives. They have been invited and successfully represented LG interests in discussions on socio-economic reforms and in the meeting of the Peace Implementation Council. They have been at the forefront of effort to introduce Common Assessment Framework into the public sector in BiH, adopting it well before most of government institutions. AMCs annual plans and reports are more user-friendly, better structured, and better prioritised than before, with greater engagement of members in some stages of the process. Advisory services related to LGF have become more robust in AMC FBiH, and the use of evidence-based advocacy has created a shift in mindsets both among the AMC staff and leadership in both Associations. New opportunities for training on EU issues have been created, opening space for new quality of partnerships with BiH Directorate for European Integration and RS Ministry for Regional Cooperation and EU integration. Some of the changes are still embryonic and their full institutionalisation will require a stronger commitment of the staff and management in both AMCs. During the next project report more attention will be paid to sustainability of results already achieved, as well as pushing for the remaining results to be in place by the end of the project.
